title: Google vs. Oracle - Java API Copyright Case
description: Google used Oracle's Java APIs in Android without a license. Oracle sued Google, claiming copyright infringement. The case went to the U.S. Supreme Court.

questions.question: Which type of intellectual property was involved in this case?
questions.hint: It protects creative works like books, music, and software.

questions.question: What was the final ruling by the U.S. Supreme Court?
options: Google won, as it was fair use
Oracle won, as it was copyright infringement
questions.answer: Google won, as it was fair use
questions.hint: The ruling favored software developers' ability to reuse APIs.

questions.question: What is fair use in copyright law?
options: Using copyrighted material under specific conditions
questions.answer: Using copyrighted material under specific conditions
questions.hint: Fair use allows limited use of copyrighted material under legal conditions.

title: Apple vs. Samsung - Smartphone Patent War
description: Apple sued Samsung for infringing on iPhone design patents, claiming Samsung copied its product look and feel.

questions.question: Which type of intellectual property was the focus of this lawsuit?
questions.hint: It protects inventions and product designs.

questions.question: What was the outcome of this lawsuit?
options: Apple won and Samsung had to pay damages
Samsung won and Apple had to pay damages
questions.answer: Apple won and Samsung had to pay damages
questions.hint: The court ruled that Samsung copied Appleâ€™s product design.

questions.question: What does a patent protect?
questions.hint: It grants exclusive rights to an inventor for their creation.

title: TikTok Data Privacy Concerns
description: TikTok faced scrutiny over user data privacy and potential intellectual property violations in the U.S.

questions.question: What major concern was raised regarding TikTok?
questions.hint: It relates to how user information is collected and stored.

questions.question: Which law governs data privacy in the U.S.?
questions.hint: This law protects California residents' online privacy.

questions.question: What is the main purpose of the GDPR?
questions.hint: It is a European regulation that safeguards personal data.
